sanskrit_verse:
नोच्छिन्द्यादात्मनो मूलं परेषां चातितृष्णया ।
उच्छिन्दन् ह्यात्मनो मूलमात्मानं तांश्च पीडयेत् ॥ ७.१३९॥
transliteration:
na ucchindya ātmanaḥ mūlaṁ pareṣāṁ cāti tṛṣṇayā |
ucchindan hy ātmanaḥ mūlam ātmānaṁ tāṁś ca pīḍayet || 7.139||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must not sever the root of one's own Self through excessive desire for others' possessions; indeed, one who severs the root of the Self thereby harms oneself and those very objects of desire.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates in Self-integrity, not external ownership.
Causation flows from internal consciousness distortion to external misalignment.
Capacity-based responsibility arises from the power to sustain or destroy one’s own foundational integrity.
Restoration logic requires reconnection to the unsevered Self-root.
Consciousness alignment demands recognition of unity between Self and world.
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual acts to acquire another's property through greed THAT CAUSES disconnection from their own Self-root THEN trigger restoration protocol via reflective reintegration.
IF a person damages societal harmony by violating Self-root integrity THEN assign completion process involving restitution through alignment practices.
IF desire exceeds capacity to preserve Self-root integrity THEN initiate consciousness recalibration before legal standing is restored.
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating disputes over possession or acquisition driven by greed, the Supreme Court shall assess whether the action severed the litigant’s connection to their own Self-root. If proven, punitive remedies are void; instead, mandatory restoration protocols ensuring realignment with intrinsic Self-value shall apply.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Through pramāṇa-based inquiry into the causal chain, it is established that severing the Self-root precedes harm to others. Therefore, proportional responsibility lies solely in restoring the lost Self-reference point. As per anupūrvaśaḥ, rectification follows sequential realization of inner unity preceding outer balance. No punitive consequence aligns with nyāya when dharma itself is self-restoring.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Svādhyāya-based inquiry to restore awareness of Self-root.
Assign Tapas-based discipline to rebuild capacity for non-exploitative relationship with objects.
Implement Samyama protocols to dissolve attachment patterns causing Self-severance.
Facilitate community service aligned with personal dharma to reintegrate social harmony.
final_declaration: This law proceeds from Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, as Source-Authority. It declares Dharma restored through recognition of the indivisible Self-root. Justice operates without punishment, guided by consciousness alone. Reality responds only to truth re-established within the Self.
